intro: Hibiscus calycinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink, often with a prominent yellow center. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically velvety to the touch, contributing to its common name. Hibiscus calycinus thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its flowers bloom throughout the growing season, adding continuous color to gardens and landscapes.
